titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Frederic Prokosch Collection
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 4, 2019 at 04:07

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Frederic Prokosch collection contains material by or relating to American novelist and translator Frederic Prokosch. There are corrected drafts and proofs to several early novels, including The Asiatics (1935), The Seven Who Fled (1937), The Conspirators (1943), Age of Thunder (1945), The Idols of the Cave (1946), and Storm and Echo (1948). There are also drafts of shorter works, including stories and individual poems, as well as three collections of poetry dating from the same period, specifically, The Assassions (1936), The Carnival (1938), and Death at Sea (1940). Additional materials include correspondence, photographs, printed material, such as clippings and reviews, and personal and family papers.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift and purchase from various sources, 1941-1999. For additional information see the appropriate curator.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Frederic Prokosch Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Frederic Prokosch Collection. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing, including in some instances rehousing and minimal organization, when it arrived at the library.

In 2013, each acquisition was listed separately in the Collection Contents section below according to date of acquisition. As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Za Prokosch, Uncat Za MS 288, Uncat Za MS 388, and Uncat MSS 16.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Microfilm available for portions of the collection.

bioghist.head: Frederic Prokosch (1908-1989)
bioghist.p: Frederic Prokosch, novelist and translator, was born May 17, 1908, in Madison, Wisconsin, to Edouard and Mathilde (Dapprich) Prokosch. He was educated at Haverford College (1926, 1928), the University of Pennsylvania, Yale University (1933), and Cambridge University. Prokosch served as an instructor in English at Yale University (1932-1934), a faculty member at New York University (1936-1937), and a cultural attache for the U.S. Office of War Information in Stockholm (1943-1944) before spending most of the rest of his life in Europe. His first novel, The Asiastics (1935), a picaresque novel about a young man's travels from Lebanon to China, drew praise from established literary figures, and his second novel, The Seven Who Fled (1937), earned the Harper Prize. Prokosch's memoir, Voices , appeared in 1984. He died June 2, 1989, in Plan de Grasse, France.
Biographical information taken from "Frederic Prokosch." Contemporary Authors Online . Detroit: Gale, 2003. Gale Biography In Context . Web. 4 Jan. 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Frederic Prokosch collection contains material by or relating to American novelist and translator Frederic Prokosch. There are corrected drafts and proofs to several early novels, including The Asiatics (1935), The Seven Who Fled (1937), The Conspirators (1943), Age of Thunder (1945), The Idols of the Cave (1946), and Storm and Echo (1948). There are also drafts of shorter works, including stories and individual poems, as well as three collections of poetry dating from the same period, specifically, The Assassions (1936), The Carnival (1938), and Death at Sea (1940). Additional materials include correspondence, photographs, printed material, such as clippings and reviews, and personal and family papers.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into ten groupings by date of acquisition: I. August 1941 Acquisition. II November 1941 Acquisition. III October 1944 Acquisition. IV. 1945-1948 Acquisitions. V. March 1963 Acquisition. VI. October 1963 Acquisition. VII. July 1992 Acquisition. VIII. November 1993 Acquisition. IX. December 1999 Acquisition. X. Other Acquisitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The August 1941 Acquisition consists of drafts of three manuscripts, including Prokosch's first published novel, The Asiatics (1935).
Former call number: Za Prokosch.

did.unittitle: The Asiatics , draft, typescript carbon, corrected

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The November 1941 Acquisition consists of shorter writings by Prokosch, including stories and collections of poems.
Former call number: Za Prokosch.

did.unittitle: "Death of a Poet," autograph manuscript, corrected
"Fog Over the Wisconsin," autograph manuscript, corrected
"My Friend Waldemar," story, autograph manuscript, corrected
"The Return From the Picnic," autograph manuscript
"The Somnabulists," poems, typescript carbon, and "The Wolves," poems, typescript
"The Statue In the Garden," autograph manuscript, corrected
"View of Lisbon," story, autograph manuscript, corrected
"Visit To the Margravine," autograph manuscript, corrected

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The October 1944 Acquisition consists of corrected drafts and proofs for the three novels The Asiatics (1935), The Conspirators (1943), and The Seven Who Fled (1937).
Former call number: Za Prokosch.

did.unittitle: The Asiatics , typescript, corrected, with proofreaders' marks and printer's annotations
The Conspirators , typescript carbon, corrected, with printer's annotations
The Conspirators , page proof, corrected, with proofreaders' marks and printer's annotations
The Conspirators , page proof, corrected, with proofreaders' marks and printer's annotations
The Seven Who Fled , typescript, corrected, with proofreaders' marks and printer's annotations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The 1945-1948 Acquisitions include drafts of the novels Age of Thunder (1945), The Idols of the Cave (1946), and Storm and Echo (1948).
Former call number: Za Prokosch.

did.unittitle: Age of Thunder , draft, typescript, corrected, with proofreaders' marks and printer's annotations
Age of Thunder , draft, typescript, corrected, with proofreaders' marks and printer's annotations
The Idols of the Cave , draft, typescript and autograph manuscript, corrected
Storm and Echo , draft, typescript, corrected

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The March 1963 Acquisition consists of corrected galley and plate proofs of the novel The Seven Who Fled (1937) and a publisher's correspondence file relating to Prokosch.
Former call number: Za Prokosch.

did.unittitle: The Seven Who Fled , galley proof, corrected, with proofreaders' marks and printer's annotations
The Seven Who Fled , plate proof, corrected, with proofreaders' marks and printer's annotations

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The October 1963 Acquisition consists of a typescript mimeograph draft of The Dark Dancer (1964).
Former call number: Za Prokosch.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of The Book of the Month Club.

did.unittitle: The Dark Dancer , draft, typescript mimoegraph

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The July 1992 Acquisition consists of material relating to the novel The Asiatics (1935) and three collections of poems, The Assassions (1936), The Carnival (1938), and Death at Sea (1940). Materials include manuscript notes and draft fragments, correspondence, and printed ephemera.
Former call number: Uncat Za MS 288.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Bertram Rota on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Fund.

did.unittitle: The Assassins , draft, proofs, printed material, and correspondence
The Carnival , proofs, printed material, and correspondence
Death at Sea , drafts and correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The November 1993 Acquisition consists of manuscript drafts and fragments of poems removed from printed material.
Former call number: Uncat Za MS 388.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains proofs for limited editions prepared by Prokosch

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains proofs for limited editions prepared by Prokosch

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The December 1999 Acquisition consists of correspondence, writings, photographs, printed material, and family papers by or relating to Frederic Prokosch and the Prokosh family.
Former call number: Uncat MSS 16.

did.unittitle: Reviews and clippings for The Carnival
Reviews of The Night of the Poor
Reviews and clippings for The Asiatics
The English Novel, edited by Verschoyle

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This grouping contains other small acquisitions of material by or relating to Frederic Prokosch.
Former call number: Za Prokosch.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Acquired by gift from various sources. For additional information see the appropriate curator.
